title: Caoxian Hanfu Cultural Festival: Showcasing Traditional Chinese Costumes and Boosting Rural Vitalization
originBody: HOME ABOUT Overview Cities Photo Gallery Videos NEWS Latest Features Reports in PDF DEVELOPMENTS Transformed Development Drivers Rural Vitalization Marine Economy CULTURE What’s On Heritage Traditional Culture Celebrities INTL EXCHANGE Why Shandong Industrial parks Belt and Road Sister Cities BRANDS Strategies Companies TRAVEL Attractions Dining LIVING Visas Healthcare Transportation Education Marriage Useful Info 中文 btn-search btn-facebook btn-twitter Search Home > Developments>Rural Vitalization Traditional Chinese costumes boost rural vitalization in Caoxian (chinadaily.com.cn)| Updated : 2023-11-17 Print Print The first Caoxian Hanfu Cultural Festival kicked off on Nov 11 in Caoxian county, Shandong province. The month-long event will feature a host of activities, including exhibitions, forums, sales promotions, traditional culture lectures, and performances, aimed at raising the profile of the local industry for traditional Chinese costumes, especially the hanfu. An exhibition hall of traditional Chinese costumes in Caoxian county, Shandong province. [Photo provided to chinadaily.com.cn] Trends popular among the country's youth such as "China chic" (designs featuring elements from traditional Chinese culture), and the growing influence of young consumer groups have driven the development of the hanfu industry in recent years, and Caoxian has seized these opportunities to boost its own profile. Caoxian is currently home to 2,282 upstream and downstream enterprises in the hanfu industry that have 13,989 online stores on various e-commerce platforms, including Taobao, Tmall, JD, Pinduoduo, Douyin, Kuaishou, and Xiaohongshu. There are presently some 100,000 professionals working in the industry. A staff member sells traditional Chinese costumes via livestreaming in Caoxian county. [Photo provided to chinadaily.com.cn] The county has formed a complete industrial chain and brand incubation system that covers original research and development, design and production, accessory production, copyright protection, experiential exhibitions, and online marketing. According to data from Chinese online discounter Pinduoduo, out of its top 2,000 online hanfu stores, 1,200 are from Caoxian. Additionally, over half of the top 100 hanfu stores on the platform are also based in Caoxian. Caoxian's share of the domestic hanfu market is more than 40 percent. A model presents traditional Chinese costumes. [Photo provided to chinadaily.com.cn] Related Stories Condiment sector seasons township's rapid growth Shandong park provides rosy outlook for villagers Shandong strengthens talent cultivation to boost rural vitalization Features Shandong remains popular destination for foreign investment Prominent voices at Nishan forum: Insights from leading experts The ninth Nishan Forum on World Civilizations Developments Transformed Development Drivers Rural Revitalization Marine Economy About Overview Cities Photo Gallery Videos News Latest Features Reports in PDF Developments Transformed Development Drivers Rural Vitalization Marine Economy Culture What's on Heritage Traditional Culture Celebrities Intl Exchange Why Shandong Industrial Parks Belt & Road Sister Cities Brands Strategies Companies Travel Attractions Dining Living Visas Healthcare Transportation Education Marriage Useful Info Fackbook Twitter Links > China (Shandong) Pilot Free Trade Zone Qingdao Area Qingdao West Coast New Area Shandong Provincial People's Government Zibo Cultural Jining Shandong Culture and Tourism Charming Qingdao Jinan, A City of Springs Tai'an Wonderland Yantai Weifang Hi-Tech Industrial Development Zone Copyright 2023 . The Information Office of Shandong Provincial People’s Government. All rights reserved. Presented by China Daily. 京ICP备13028878号-6 goTop
originSummary: The first Caoxian Hanfu Cultural Festival has started in Shandong province, China.
The festival aims to promote the local industry for traditional Chinese costumes known as hanfu.
Caoxian has a thriving hanfu industry with over 2,000 enterprises and 13,000 online stores, benefiting from the popularity of "China chic" and the influence of young consumer groups.

title: Tesla Takes Action Against Sale of Counterfeit Vehicles in China
originBody: (Source: Pinduoduo) Auto Tesla Responds to the Sale of Counterfeit Products: Legal Department Will Take Action Nov 17, 2023, 17:00pm2023/11/17 17:05:02 Pandaily Add to Favorites Added to Favorites Recently, there has been some counterfeit small electric vehicles resembling Tesla appearing on domestic e-commerce platforms in China. Its appearance and logo are very similar to Tesla‘s, and it is priced at around 10,000-20,000 yuan (approximatly ＄1,380-2,760). Surprisingly, this counterfeit model is selling very well in the market, with cumulative sales of related product links reaching thousands. On a certain e-commerce platform, the customer service of a store said: ‘This is an imitation of Tesla’s personal mobility vehicle, the new model for the second half of this year, with warranty.’ Regarding infringement allegations, the customer service responded that this model has been sold for some time and they will not close down temporarily due to infringement. On November 15th, Tesla China’s customer service responded that the company’s relevant departments will follow up on this matter. If it is confirmed to be an infringement, the legal department will handle it. It is worth mentioning that in August of this year, a counterfeit product called ‘Tesla Beer’ was ordered by the court to compensate Tesla with 5 million yuan (approximatly ＄0.7 million) for trademark infringement. SEE ALSO: Tesla Model Y and Model 3 Raise Price in China Sign up today for 5 free articles monthly! Sign in with google Sign in with Email or subscribe to a full access plan... Tags Chinaelectric vehicletesla
originSummary: Counterfeit small electric vehicles that closely resemble Tesla's design and logo have emerged on Chinese e-commerce platforms, being sold at significantly lower prices.
These counterfeit models have gained popularity, with thousands of product links being sold.
Tesla China's customer service has acknowledged the issue and stated that they will investigate and involve their legal department if it is confirmed as trademark infringement.

title: Chinese Stocks Plummet as Biden and Xi Meeting Sparks Concerns on China Outlook
originBody: Yahoo Finance Video Chinese stocks reeling from Biden-Xi meeting, China outlook Read full article 4 Brad Smith and Luke Carberry Mogan Thu, November 16, 2023 at 8:47 AM CST The APEC (Asia-Pacific Economic Cooperation) Summit in San Francisco continues after its headline event: President Biden's meeting with Chinese President Xi Jinping on Wednesday. Chinese stocks are seemingly still reeling from the talks between the world leaders and forecasts on business investments into China, as Alibaba (BABA), Pinduoduo (PDD), and JD.com (JD) shares see losses in today's pre-market trading. Yahoo Finance Markets Reporter Jared Blikre takes a closer look at Chinese and China-exposed stocks in relation to China's expected GDP decline. For more expert insight and the latest market action, click here to watch this full episode of Yahoo Finance Live. Video Transcript - As APAC continues in San Francisco, many investors still looking for exposure to the world's second biggest economy, even though China is still feeling the squeeze. For more on this, we've got Yahoo Finance's reporter, Jared Blikre, to break it all down. Hey, Jared. JARED BLIKRE: Hey there. Well I'm taking a look here at the NASDAQ Golden Dragon Index, and we can see a lot of these stocks that are native to foreign to China and to Hong Kong are really taking a beating here. Alibaba which was up 3.82% yesterday, that's the background, you can see in the early morning we are down 8.18%. Pinduoduo down 3%. NetEase down 3. JD.com down 5. And the list goes on. So a lot of pressure here. Now, if I look at China-- Chinese exposed stocks that are actually from the US that are based in the US, there's a lot less carnage. Broadcom down 1.5%. NVIDIA derives a lot of its income from China, down 7/10%. Apple huge in China that's actually up a half a percent. So it looks like the domestic securities over there are having a more difficult time digesting all of this. And we've been talking about the foreign direct investment in China that has fallen off a cliff. And first, I want to show you Chinese GDP because this is their demographic-- this kind of relates to their demographic time bomb as their population ages. They have lower growth expectations. Story continues And if you're looking at this, we're talking about three to 3% in the long term. That is a far cry from the 10% that we expected a little more than a decade ago. And then on to the foreign direct investment, that has fallen off a cliff as well. This goes back to the early 2000s here. And you can see the line-- and these are the purple bars that I'm looking at. These are the purple lines that reflect direct investment, these have gone negative. So an actual reversal of that. Now, this cyan line right here is the interest rate differential between the US and the Chinese bonds on the 10 year tenor. And what this is showing is, because US interest rates have risen so rapidly and to such a large degree, they're actually competing with China for a lot of the yield that investors around the global are looking for. So China's lost out on a lot of business through its zero tolerance, no COVID policy. They didn't reopen as quickly as they wanted to. They've struggled to really kick start their own stock market. And you take a look at KWEB for instance, that's my proxy for what's going on over there. Let's see if I can find this here. And if I go to a year to date chart, that's going to be one of the bottom performers here I believe. Well anyway, KWEB down 4.9% for the year. Let's take a look at a five year chart. You can see, peaked really on early on in 2021. US tech did something like this, and Chinese tech did something like this, the wrong direction. So there's a lot of still frosty relations between the US and China, and we'll have to see where this all shakes out. But things are dicey. I don't think there's any way around that. Related Quotes Symbol Last Price Change % Change BABA Alibaba Group Holding Limited79.11 -7.96 -9.14% BABAF Alibaba Group Holding Limited9.95 -0.87 -8.04% JD JD.com, Inc.28.08 -0.51 -1.78% JDCMF JD.com, Inc.14.12 -0.26 -1.80% KWEB KraneShares CSI China Internet ETF27.55 -1.17 -4.07% TRENDING 1. UPDATE 1-LSEG CEO urges progress in UK pension cash shift to companies 2. ECB's Nagel calls for cut in interest paid on bank reserves 3. Retail investors crowd into Eli Lilly after weight-loss drug approval 4. FOREX-Dollar set for steep weekly fall, dollar-yen snaps back below 150 5. UPDATE 1-Eli Lilly extends tender offer to buy Point Biopharma after low participation
originSummary: Chinese stocks like Alibaba, Pinduoduo, and JD.com are seeing losses in pre-market trading after the APEC Summit meeting between President Biden and Chinese President Xi Jinping
Concerns about China's anticipated GDP decline and its effect on business investments are contributing to the decline in Chinese stocks

Chinese stocks based in the US are under less pressure compared to those based in China and Hong Kong due to factors like declining foreign direct investment and competition with rising US interest rates. The US-China relationship remains tense, and the future of China's economy is uncertain.

title: Samyang Foods Achieves Record Sales on China's Singles Day
originBody: November 17, 2023 SUBSCRIBE NOW LOG IN MY PAGE PC Start ups & Investors Tech Samsung LG Mobile & Internet Blockchain Markets Stocks & Bonds Deals Economy Finance Office Consulting Companies Automobiles Retail & Consumer Bio & Medicine Industrials The Boardroom Second Opinion SNS Channel 검색폼 SUBSCRIBE NOW LOG IN MY PAGE Samyang post record sales on China's Singles Day PUBLISHED : November 17, 2023 - 09:43 UPDATED : November 17, 2023 - 09:43 Samyang Foods advertisement for China's Singles Day shopping festival (Samyang Foods) South Korean food manufacturer Samyang Foods said Thursday it posted new record sales of 13 billion won ($10 million) on this year’s Singles Day, a Chinese shopping festival celebrated every year on Nov. 11. The figure is a jump of 39 percent from a year ago, beating the previous record high of 11 billion won in 2021. Of the total earnings, 8 billion won came through e-commerce giants Alibaba and JD, while short-video platforms Douyin -- China’s version of TikTok -- and Kuaishou as well as online group-buying platform Pinduoduo drew the rest of the sales. Samyang attributed the upbeat sales to its bestselling Buldak Spicy Chicken Ramen series and Chacharoni, its black bean sauce noodle brand. During the shopping fest, it also introduced a limited-edition Buldak variety of South Korean sweet and spicy marinated fried chicken, or “yangnyeom chicken.” All 2,000 boxes of the new Buldak variety sold out much earlier than expected, the company said. “While China’s consumption recovery is still underway, we were able to bear a fruitful result this year with the expanded sales channels,” said a Samyang Foods official. “Through our Chinese sales subsidiary in Shanghai, we plan to target the local market in line with the growing live commerce industry.” By Mun So-jeong (munsojeong@heraldcorp.com) EDITOR'S PICKS LG to debut EV chargers in US next year Chinese beer imports plunge amid Tsingtao scandal [Herald Interview] Lotus bets big on Korea’s luxury car market Global asset firms flock to Jeonju to woo pension giant Naver's QR payment service available in 42 countries [Herald Interview] Korean team wins James Dyson Award with ‘hands-free’ IV drip Samsung, SK chiefs may accompany president during visit to Netherlands Google offers data residency for Korean corporate clients MOST READ ABOUT US| CONTACT US| USER AGREEMENT PRIVACY POLICY| YOUTH PROTECTION POLICY Desktop Version| Herald Corporation|Title : The Investor CEO : Jeon Chang-hyeop|Publisher. Editor : Jeon Chang-hyeop Chief Privacy Officer & Juvenile Protection Manager : Ahn Sung-mi Date of registration : 2016. 06.21|Date of issue : 2016. 06. 21 Company Registration No. 104-81-06004 Mail-Order Business Registration 2016 - Seoul Yongsan - 00590 Huam-ro 4-gil 10, Yongsan-gu, Seoul, Korea T : +82-2-727-0114|Business info Gov’t registration No. Seoul 아04099 COPYRIGHT HERALD CORPORATION. ALL RIGHTS RESERVED.
originSummary: Samyang Foods, a South Korean food manufacturer, achieved record sales of 13 billion won ($10 million) on China's Singles Day, an annual shopping festival celebrated on November 11.
This represents a significant 39% increase from the previous year, driven by the popularity of the Buldak Spicy Chicken Ramen series and Chacharoni brand.
Samyang attributes its success to expanded sales channels and plans to further target the local market through its Chinese subsidiary.

"@context": "http://schema.org", "@type": "Article", "headline": "Jack Ma's family trust to sell Alibaba shares amid US export curbs", "image": "https://img-s-msn-com.akamaized.net/tenant/amp/entityid/AA1k1LmW.img?w=1280&h=720&m=4&q=70", "author": "", "publisher": { "name": "The Times of India", "logo": { "@type": "ImageObject", "url": "https://img-s-msn-com.akamaized.net/tenant/amp/entityid/BB1ai7Sb.img" } }, "url": "http://www.msn.com/en-in/news/world/jack-ma-s-family-trust-to-sell-alibaba-shares-amid-us-export-curbs/ar-AA1k1YST?domshim=1", "datePublished": "2023-11-16T13:11:00Z", "dateModified": "2023-11-16T13:28:42Z", "description": "Alibaba Group Holding reported a 9% increase in revenue for Q3, reaching 224.8 billion yuan ($31 billion), in line with market expectations. However, this marks a slight dip from the previous quarter. Jack Ma's family trust plans to sell 10 million American Depository Shares of Alibaba for around $871 million. The company also canceled its planned spin-off of the Cloud Intelligence arm due to US restrictions on advanced computing chips....", "articleBody": "Chinese e-commerce giant Alibaba Group Holding reported its third-quarter results, showcasing a 9% year-on-year increase in revenue, reaching 224.8 billion yuan ($31 billion). This performance aligns with market expectations but indicates a slight dip from the previous quarter's 234.1 billion yuan. The figures reflect a steady recovery in China's retail sector post-pandemic.In a surprising move, Jack Ma's family trust is set to sell 10 million American Depository Shares of Alibaba Group Holdings for approximately $871 million. The sale by JSP Investment and JC Properties, funds within the family trust, is scheduled for November 21. Alibaba's U.S.-listed shares saw a more than 3% decline in premarket trading ahead of the quarterly results.Adding to the complex narrative, Alibaba announced the cancellation of its planned spin-off of the Cloud Intelligence arm. This decision is attributed to the recent expansion of U.S. restrictions on the export of advanced computing chips, creating uncertainties for the prospects of the Cloud Intelligence Group. The company expressed doubts about a full spin-off achieving the intended enhancement of shareholder value and instead plans to focus on developing a sustainable growth model for the Cloud Intelligence Group.Alibaba's Q3 performance reflects a solid quarter marked by renewed momentum and energy across multiple businesses, following the strategic reorganization announced earlier this year. CEO Eddie Wu highlighted the company's commitment to developing a more nimble structure to navigate new regulatory challenges and global economic pressures.The economic recovery in China remains uneven, with Alibaba's results reflecting resilience in the retail and industrial sectors despite challenges in the property sector affecting consumer confidence. The company encouraged merchants to adopt aggressive pricing strategies during its Singles Day festival to compete with rivals such as Douyin and PDD Holdings' Pinduoduo.As Alibaba charts its course through a changing economic landscape, the divestment by Jack Ma's family trust, the cancellation of the cloud spin-off, and the solid Q3 results underscore the complexity and adaptability required for success in China's dynamic digital economy. The company's performance will continue to be closely monitored as it seeks to maintain competitiveness amid evolving regulatory frameworks and economic uncertainties.(with inputs from agencies)For more news like this visit TOI. For Entertainment News, TV News, and Lifestyle Tips visit Etimes" }The Times of India Jack Ma's family trust to sell Alibaba shares amid US export curbsPosted: 16 November 2023Last updated: 16 November 2023Chinese e-commerce giant Alibaba Group Holding reported its third-quarter results, showcasing a 9% year-on-year increase in revenue, reaching 224.8 billion yuan ($31 billion). This performance aligns with market expectations but indicates a slight dip from the previous quarter's 234.1 billion yuan. The figures reflect a steady recovery in China's retail sector post-pandemic.In a surprising move, Jack Ma's family trust is set to sell 10 million American Depository Shares of Alibaba Group Holdings for approximately $871 million. The sale by JSP Investment and JC Properties, funds within the family trust, is scheduled for November 21. Alibaba's U.S.-listed shares saw a more than 3% decline in premarket trading ahead of the quarterly results.Adding to the complex narrative, Alibaba announced the cancellation of its planned spin-off of the Cloud Intelligence arm. This decision is attributed to the recent expansion of U.S. restrictions on the export of advanced computing chips, creating uncertainties for the prospects of the Cloud Intelligence Group. The company expressed doubts about a full spin-off achieving the intended enhancement of shareholder value and instead plans to focus on developing a sustainable growth model for the Cloud Intelligence Group.Alibaba's Q3 performance reflects a solid quarter marked by renewed momentum and energy across multiple businesses, following the strategic reorganization announced earlier this year. CEO Eddie Wu highlighted the company's commitment to developing a more nimble structure to navigate new regulatory challenges and global economic pressures.The economic recovery in China remains uneven, with Alibaba's results reflecting resilience in the retail and industrial sectors despite challenges in the property sector affecting consumer confidence. The company encouraged merchants to adopt aggressive pricing strategies during its Singles Day festival to compete with rivals such as Douyin and PDD Holdings' Pinduoduo.As Alibaba charts its course through a changing economic landscape, the divestment by Jack Ma's family trust, the cancellation of the cloud spin-off, and the solid Q3 results underscore the complexity and adaptability required for success in China's dynamic digital economy. The company's performance will continue to be closely monitored as it seeks to maintain competitiveness amid evolving regulatory frameworks and economic uncertainties.(with inputs from agencies)For more news like this visit TOI. Alibaba experienced a 9% revenue growth in Q3, but decided to cancel the spin-off of its Cloud Intelligence arm.
Alibaba faces regulatory hurdles and economic pressures in China's digital economy.

title: China's Alibaba cancels cloud unit spinoff in response to US chip curbs
originBody: (Reuters) -China’s Alibaba Group Holding said on Thursday it will scrap the spin off of its cloud unit in response to export curbs by the United States on chips used in artificial intelligence applications. Its U.S.-listed shares fell about 5% in premarket trading after it also reported second-quarter revenue in line with market expectations. “The recent expansion of U.S. restrictions on export of advanced computing chips has created uncertainties for the prospects of Cloud Intelligence Group,” Alibaba said. The e-commerce giant posted revenue of 224.79 billion yuan ($31.01 billion) in the quarter, compared with analysts’ average estimate of 224.32 billion yuan, according to LSEG data. China’s economic recovery has been uneven. While the industrial and the retail sectors performed better than expected, the crisis-hit property sector still weighed on consumer confidence.Alibaba resorted to pressuring merchants to price aggressively during its Singles Day festival as it looks to take on competitors such as Douyin and PDD Holdings’ Pinduoduo who have been selling lower-cost products year-round. This is the first quarterly results for CEO Eddie Wu, one of Alibaba Group’s co-founders and long-time lieutenant of former chief Jack Ma, who took over from former group chief executive Daniel Zhang in September. ($1 = 7.2481 Chinese yuan renminbi) (Reporting by Akash Sriram in Bengaluru. Editing by Sam Holmes and Arun Koyyur)
originSummary: Alibaba will not proceed with the spin-off of its cloud unit due to US export restrictions on AI chips, resulting in a 5% drop in its US-listed shares.
The expansion of US export restrictions has created uncertainty for Alibaba's Cloud Intelligence Group.
China's economic recovery has been uneven, with the industrial and retail sectors outperforming expectations while the property sector has negatively impacted consumer confidence.

title: Chinese stocks reel as Biden-Xi meeting dampens China outlook
originBody: Yahoo Finance published this video item, entitled “Chinese stocks reeling from Biden-Xi meeting, China outlook” – below is their description. The APEC (Asia-Pacific Economic Cooperation) Summit in San Francisco continues after its headline event: President Biden’s meeting with Chinese President Xi Jinping on Wednesday. Chinese stocks are seemingly still reeling from the talks between the world leaders and forecasts on business investments into China, as Alibaba (BABA), Pinduoduo (PDD), and JD.com (JD) shares see losses in today’s pre-market trading. Yahoo Finance Markets Reporter Jared Blikre takes a closer look at Chinese and China-exposed stocks in relation to China’s expected GDP decline. For more expert insight and the latest market action, click here to watch this full episode of Yahoo Finance Live.
